page.title: 01Introduction.
page.content: The area is predominantly farmland. The{limestone}rock is responsible for an{alkaline soil}in which cereal crops are grown.There are eleven farms,about half of which are privately owned. A number of{disused railway lines criss-cross the area,closed as a result of the{Beeching Plan. The{A1 trunk road}cuts across the area,providing an important link in the motorway chain of the country.To ease the problem of crossing this very busy road{a new intersection is being {built. There are two contrasting villages in the area,Upton and Skelbrooke.Upton is a former mining village,declining since the mine was closed.Skelbrooke, however, is a quiet sleepy village which is inhabited mainly by people who have retired.
